dtl_desc: TO ELECT JIM WRIGHT OF TEXAS SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES OVER ROBERT H MICHEL OF ILLINOIS. A 'YEA' VOTE IS CODED '1' AND A 'NAY' VOTE IS CODED '6'.
TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H RES 5, RULES OF THE HOUSE, THE RESOLUTION TO ADOPT THE RULES OF THE HOUSE FOR THE ONE HUNDREDTH CONGRESS.

TO ADOPT H RES 5, RULES OF THE HOUSE, A RESOLUTION TO ADOPT THE RULES OF THE HOUSE FOR THE ONE HUNDREDTH CONGRESS.

TO PASS H.R. 1, THE CLEAN AIR ACT, A BILL TO AMEND AND REAUTHORIZE THE CLEAN WATER ACT OF 1972 TO PROVIDE FOR THE RENEWAL OF THE QUALITY OF THE NATION'S WATER.
TO ADOPT TITLE I OF H RES 26 TO ESTABLISH A SELECT COMMITTEE ON HUNGER, ONE OF THREE SELECT COMMITTEES ESTABLISHED BY THE RESOLUTION.

TO AMEND HR 558, URGENT RELIEF FOR THE HOMELESS, TO REQUIRE THAT HOMELESS PERSONS SEEKING OUTPATIENT HEALTH SERVICES UNDER THE BILL BE TESTED FOR AIDS.

MOTION FAILED; TWO-THIRDS OF THOSE PRESENT NOT VOTING IN FAVOR.

TO ADOPT H RES 139, THE RULE TO PROVIDE FOR HOUSE FLOOR CONSIDERATION OF H CON RES 93, FISCAL 1988 BUDGET RESOLUTION, THE CONCURRENT RESOLUTION TO SET FISCAL 1988 BUDGET TOTALS.

TO AMEND IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE H CON RES 93, FISCAL 1988 BUDGET RESOLUTION, TO SET FISCAL 1988 BUDGET TOTALS: NEW BUDGET AUTHORITY AT $1.142 TRILLION; OUTLAYS AT $1.024 TRILLION; REVENUES AT $916.6 BILLION; DEFICIT AT $107.8 BILLION.

TO AMEND IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE H CON RES 93, FISCAL 1988 BUDGET RESOLUTION, TO SET FISCAL 1988 BUDGET TOTALS: NEW BUDGET AUTHORITY AT $1.135 TRILLION; OUTLAYS AT $1.027 TRILLION; REVENUES AT $919.4 BILLION; DEFICIT AT $108 BILLION. THE AMENDMENT SOUGHT DOMESTIC SPENDING REDUCTIONS OF $26.2 BILLION AND REFINANCING OF THE NATIONAL DEBT WITH GOLD-BACKED BONDS.

TO AMEND IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE H CON RES 93, FISCAL 1988 BUDGET RESOLUTION,  TO SET FISCAL 1988 BUDGET TOTALS: NEW BUDGET AUTHORITY AT $1.179 TRILLION; REVENUES AT $989 BILLION; DEFICIT AT $105.7 BILLION. THE AMENDMENT SOUGHT DOMESTIC SPENDING INCREASES OF $35 BILLION AND REVENUE INCREASES OF $64 BILLION.

TO AMEND IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE H CON RES 93, FISCAL 1988 BUDGET RESOLUTION, TO SET FISCAL 1988 BUDGET TOTALS: NEW BUDGET AUTHORITY AT $1.142 TRILLION; OUTLAYS AT $1.039 TRILLION; REVENUES AT $930.9 BILLION; DEFICIT AT $107.6 BILLION. THE AMENDMENT SOUGHT $17.5 BILLION IN SPENDING CUTS AND $18 BILLION IN LEGISLATIVE REVENUE INCREASES.

TO AMEND HR 5210, OMNIBUS DRUG BILL, TO DENY FEDERAL BENEFITS TO BOTH DRUG DEALERS AND USERS.
TO AMEND HR 5210, OMNIBUS DRUG BILL, TO AUTHORIZE STATES TO RECEIVE FEDERAL HIGHWAY FUNDS FOR A ONE YEAR PILOT STUDY FOR DRUG TESTING OF FIRST TIME DRIVER'S LICENSE APPLICANTS.
TO AMEND HR 5210, OMNIBUS DRUG BILL, TO RESTRICT THE LAUNDERING OF U.S. CURRENCY BY SUSPECTED DRUG TRAFFICKERS.
TO AMEND HR 5210, OMNIBUS DRUG BILL, TO PROHIBIT THE SALE, IMPORTATION, MANUFACTURE OR POSSESSION OF FIREARMS THAT ARE NOT DETECTABLE BY METAL DETECTION OR X-RAY SYSTEMS.

TO PASS HR 5210, OMNIBUS DRUG BILL, A BILL TO PREVENT THE MANUFACTURE, DISTRIBUTION AND USE OF ILLEGAL DRUGS AND TO STRENGTHEN LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS AND DRUG EDUCATION PROGRAMS AND IMPOSE THE DEATH PENALTY FOR DRUG RELATED MURDERS.

TO AMEND S 2751, MONTANA NATURAL RESOURCES PROTECTION, TO EXPRESS THE SENSE OF THE SENATE THAT THE U.S. SHOULD CONSULT ITS ALLIES ON PROCEDURES TO END UNTIED, GENERAL PURPOSE LENDING TO THE SOVIET UNION AND ITS ALLIES.

TO TABLE THE MCCAIN, AZ AMENDMENT TO S 2751, MONTANA NATURAL RESOURCES PROTECTION, TO CONDEMN THE SUPPRESSION OF HUMAN RIGHTS BY THE SANDINISTA GOVERNMENT IN NICARAGUA AND TO WARN THAT CONTINUED BLATANT VIOLATIONS COULD CAUSE CONGRESS TO RENEW MILITARY AID TO THE CONTRAS.
TO TABLE THE DASCHLE, SD AMENDMENT TO S 2011, VETERAN'S BENEFITS, TO PROVIDE VETERANS' EDUCATIONAL ASSISTANCE FOR FLIGHT TRAINING.
